New Records: Travis Head scored the most boundaries in a World Cup final, surpassing India's total in their innings
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma fell to Travis Head's incredible catch
Pat Cummins took out Virat Kohli
Mitchell Starc generated reverse swing and took out India's top-scorer
Adam Zampa struck to equal the highest number of wickets for a spinner in a single World Cup
Pre-Game Insights: Australia chose to bowl, expecting the pitch to get easier to bat on in the evening with dew coming in
India's Rohit Sharma preferred to set a total, but Australia's plan was to chase and take advantage of the conditions
The pitch was expected to retain moisture, giving an advantage to teams bowling first
Post-Match Reflections: India's team is perhaps the best ever assembled, but they came up short in the final
Rohit Sharma and his team will have to stomach coming in second best
The team's resilience and spirit will be a significant morale booster ahead of the World Cup
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch offered a total spectacle, with reverse swing and turn on offer
The game was made back in the drawing board, with Australia planning and executing their game plan perfectly
The crowd was electric, with over 100,000 people in attendance at the Narendra Modi Stadium
